<a id="AnimatedSprite2D"></a>

# AnimatedSprite2D

**Inherits:** [Node2D](Node2D.md) **\<** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Sprite node that contains multiple textures as frames to play for animation.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**AnimatedSprite2D** is similar to the [Sprite2D](Sprite2D.md) node, except it carries multiple textures as animation frames. Animations are created using a [SpriteFrames](SpriteFrames.md) resource, which allows you to import image files (or a folder containing said files) to provide the animation frames for the sprite. The [SpriteFrames](SpriteFrames.md) resource can be configured in the editor via the SpriteFrames bottom panel.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [2D Sprite animation](../tutorials/2d/2d_sprite_animation.md)

- [2D Dodge The Creeps Demo](https://godotengine.org/asset-library/asset/2712)

## Signals

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_signal_animation_changed"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**animation_changed**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_signal_animation_changed)

Emitted when [animation](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_animation) changes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_signal_animation_finished"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**animation_finished**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_signal_animation_finished)

Emitted when the animation reaches the end, or the start if it is played in reverse. When the animation finishes, it pauses the playback.

\ **Note:** This signal is not emitted if an animation is looping.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_signal_animation_looped"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**animation_looped**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_signal_animation_looped)

Emitted when the animation loops.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_signal_frame_changed"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**frame_changed**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_signal_frame_changed)

Emitted when [frame](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame) changes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_signal_sprite_frames_changed"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**sprite_frames_changed**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_signal_sprite_frames_changed)

Emitted when [sprite_frames](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_sprite_frames) changes.

## Property Descriptions

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_animation"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[StringName](StringName.md) **animation** = `&"default"` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_animation)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_animation**\ (\ value\: [StringName](StringName.md)\ )
- [StringName](StringName.md) **get_animation**\ (\ )

The current animation from the [sprite_frames](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_sprite_frames) resource. If this value is changed, the [frame](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame) counter and the [frame_progress](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress) are reset.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_autoplay"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **autoplay** = `""` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_autoplay)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_autoplay**\ (\ value\: [String](String.md)\ )
- [String](String.md) **get_autoplay**\ (\ )

The key of the animation to play when the scene loads.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_centered"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **centered** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_centered)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_centered**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_centered**\ (\ )

If ``true``, texture will be centered.

\ **Note:** For games with a pixel art aesthetic, textures may appear deformed when centered. This is caused by their position being between pixels. To prevent this, set this property to ``false``, or consider enabling [ProjectSettings.rendering/2d/snap/snap_2d_vertices_to_pixel](ProjectSettings.md#ProjectSettings_property_rendering/2d/snap/snap_2d_vertices_to_pixel) and [ProjectSettings.rendering/2d/snap/snap_2d_transforms_to_pixel](ProjectSettings.md#ProjectSettings_property_rendering/2d/snap/snap_2d_transforms_to_pixel).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_flip_h"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **flip_h** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_flip_h)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_flip_h**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_flipped_h**\ (\ )

If ``true``, texture is flipped horizontally.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_flip_v"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **flip_v** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_flip_v)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_flip_v**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_flipped_v**\ (\ )

If ``true``, texture is flipped vertically.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **frame** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_frame**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_frame**\ (\ )

The displayed animation frame's index. Setting this property also resets [frame_progress](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress). If this is not desired, use [set_frame_and_progress()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_set_frame_and_progress).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **frame_progress** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_frame_progress**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_frame_progress**\ (\ )

The progress value between ``0.0`` and ``1.0`` until the current frame transitions to the next frame. If the animation is playing backwards, the value transitions from ``1.0`` to ``0.0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_offset"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **offset** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_offset)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_offset**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_offset**\ (\ )

The texture's drawing offset.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_speed_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **speed_scale** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_speed_scale)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_speed_scale**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_speed_scale**\ (\ )

The speed scaling ratio. For example, if this value is ``1``, then the animation plays at normal speed. If it's ``0.5``, then it plays at half speed. If it's ``2``, then it plays at double speed.

If set to a negative value, the animation is played in reverse. If set to ``0``, the animation will not advance.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_property_sprite_frames"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[SpriteFrames](SpriteFrames.md) **sprite_frames** [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_property_sprite_frames)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sprite_frames**\ (\ value\: [SpriteFrames](SpriteFrames.md)\ )
- [SpriteFrames](SpriteFrames.md) **get_sprite_frames**\ (\ )

The [SpriteFrames](SpriteFrames.md) resource containing the animation(s). Allows you the option to load, edit, clear, make unique and save the states of the [SpriteFrames](SpriteFrames.md) resource.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_method_get_playing_speed"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_playing_speed**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_method_get_playing_speed)

Returns the actual playing speed of current animation or ``0`` if not playing. This speed is the [speed_scale](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_speed_scale) property multiplied by ``custom_speed`` argument specified when calling the [play()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_play) method.

Returns a negative value if the current animation is playing backwards.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_method_is_playing"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_playing**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_method_is_playing)

Returns ``true`` if an animation is currently playing (even if [speed_scale](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_speed_scale) and/or ``custom_speed`` are ``0``).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_method_pause"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **pause**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_method_pause)

Pauses the currently playing animation. The [frame](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame) and [frame_progress](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress) will be kept and calling [play()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_play) or [play_backwards()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_play_backwards) without arguments will resume the animation from the current playback position.

See also [stop()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_stop).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_method_play"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **play**\ (\ name\: [StringName](StringName.md) = &"", custom_speed\: [float](float.md) = 1.0, from_end\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_method_play)

Plays the animation with key `name`. If `custom_speed` is negative and `from_end` is ``true``, the animation will play backwards (which is equivalent to calling [play_backwards()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_play_backwards)).

If this method is called with that same animation `name`, or with no `name` parameter, the assigned animation will resume playing if it was paused.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_method_play_backwards"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **play_backwards**\ (\ name\: [StringName](StringName.md) = &""\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_method_play_backwards)

Plays the animation with key `name` in reverse.

This method is a shorthand for [play()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_play) with ``custom_speed = -1.0`` and ``from_end = true``, so see its description for more information.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_method_set_frame_and_progress"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_frame_and_progress**\ (\ frame\: [int](int.md), progress\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_method_set_frame_and_progress)

Sets [frame](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame) and [frame_progress](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress) to the given values. Unlike setting [frame](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame), this method does not reset the [frame_progress](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress) to ``0.0`` implicitly.

\ **Example:** Change the animation while keeping the same [frame](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame) and [frame_progress](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_property_frame_progress):




```gdscript
    var current_frame = animated_sprite.get_frame()
    var current_progress = animated_sprite.get_frame_progress()
    animated_sprite.play("walk_another_skin")
    animated_sprite.set_frame_and_progress(current_frame, current_progress)
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AnimatedSprite2D_method_stop"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **stop**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AnimatedSprite2D_method_stop)

Stops the currently playing animation. The animation position is reset to ``0`` and the ``custom_speed`` is reset to ``1.0``. See also [pause()](AnimatedSprite2D.md#AnimatedSprite2D_method_pause).
